newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine supermarket sales up 26 pct in December.
newsitem.headline: Argentine supermarket sales up 26 pct in December.

text.p: The sales of Argentina's major supermarket chains in December increased 26.1 percent on the previous month to $1.04 billion, according to an estimate released by the Economy Ministry Friday.

"As for expectations for sales in January 1997, the firms consulted said that because of seasonal factors they expect them to be more than 10 percent lower than December 1996's sales," said a statement from the ministry.
Supermarket sales are generally higher in December than other months because of Christmas shopping.
The December sales estimate compares with definitive sales figures of $827 million for November, $788 million in October, $742 million in September and $812 million in August.
